abstract.p: Mexican antitrust authorities say they will order breakup of Cintra, nation's airline monopoly and holding company of largest carriers, Mexicana and Aeromexico; decision will allow more competition in industry and should result in lower domestic airline fares; unions representing pilots and flight attendants threaten to stage protests or strikes if government follows through with decision (S)

block.p: Mexican antitrust authorities announced that they would order the breakup of Cintra, the nation's airline monopoly and the holding company of its two largest carriers, Mexicana and Aeromexico. Fernando Sanchez Ugarte, president of the Federal Antitrust Commission, said the decision would allow more competition in the airline industry and should result in lower domestic airline fares. Unions representing pilots and flight attendants threatened to stage protests or strikes if the government followed through with the decision.
